Nishanth J. Kumar
  • About Me
  • Research
  • Blog

    Hi there, and welcome to my personal website! My name’s Nishanth and I’m a researcher and engineer focused on AI and ML applications to robotics. I also moonlight as a writer and entrepreneur.

    Presently, I’m a Senior at Brown University concentrating in Computer Engineering and researching AI + Robotics under Brown’s BigAI initiative I’m advised by Professors Stefanie Tellex, George Konidaris and Michael Littman. In the past, I’ve been a Research Intern at Uber ATG under Prof. Raquel Urtasun, collaborated with researchers at MERL, helped develop and run Brown’s Graduate-Level Reinforcement Learning course, launched high-altitude balloons with Brown Space Engineering, and even served as a Brown Science Tour Guide. Outside of CS and Engineering, I run a coaching and college-counseling company for high-school students and sometimes make progress on a young-adult sci-fi novel I’ve been writing for longer than I care to admit.

    I grew up playing street-cricket and learning to love Dosa in Coimbatore, India. During my time in India, I studied and eventually taught the IB, wrote and semi self-published a novel, built and competed with robots, and even built a popular science fair project.

    To get in touch or learn more about me, check out my resume or social links in the website footer and feel free to shoot me an email!

    Recent News

    • I’ve accepted an offer to become a Ph.D. student in the Learning and Intelligent Systems Group at MIT CSAIL. This is a personal dream come true, and I’m beyond excited for all the opportunity and collaboration to come!
    • I’ve been selected as a 2021 NSF GRFP recipient!
    • I was named a Finalist for the 2021 CRA Outstanding Undergraduate Research Awards!
    • In February 2021, I gave an invited talk on Task Scoping at the Learning and Intelligent Systems Group at MIT CSAIL!
    • I was named a 2020 Heidelberg Laureate and invited to the 2021 HLF in Germany!
    • I was named a 2020 Goldwater Scholar for my research into Robotics and AI over the last few years!
    • My company, Paragon.school, is accepting applications from new students! If you’re an ambitious high-school student looking to improve your grades, time-management, extra-curriculars and college application, consider applying.
